title: THE BRAZILIAN DIGITAL BATTLEFIELD: INVESTIGATING THE DYNAMICS OF POLITICAL INFORMATION CAMPAIGNS IN POST-BOLSONARO ERA | AoIR Selected Papers of Internet Research
snippet: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a study investigating misinformation campaigns on Facebook in Brazil following the 2022 elections, analyzing coordinated link sharing and identifying distinct networks supporting different political figures.
description: Fabio Giglietto co-authored a study on misinformation campaigns in Brazil following the 2022 elections, analyzing link sharing on Facebook and identifying networks supporting different political figures. This research aligns with his expertise in social media analysis and disinformation studies.

title: Health Discourse Research Initiative
snippet: This page mentions Fabio Giglietto as part of a team from the Università di Urbino Carlo Bo working on identifying coordinated link-sharing networks on Facebook, focusing on health information in Nigeria and India. The research uses the CooRnet package on CrowdTangle data.
description: The "Health Discourse Research Initiative" page mentions Fabio Giglietto as part of a Università di Urbino Carlo Bo team researching coordinated link-sharing networks on Facebook related to health information in Nigeria and India, utilizing the CooRnet package on CrowdTangle data.

title: DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2025/2026 - Uniurb
snippet: This page describes the course 'DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS' taught by Fabio Giglietto at the University of Urbino. It outlines the course's objectives, program, and learning achievements, indicating his role as a lecturer in this field.
description: The web page describes the 'DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS' course taught by Fabio Giglietto at the University of Urbino, outlining the course's objectives and content, thus showcasing his role as a lecturer and expert in digital social network analysis.

Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
Scientists around the world call to protect research on one of humanity's greatest short-term threats – Disinformation
snippet: Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino is listed as one of the signatories of a collective open letter urging the protection of disinformation research, emphasizing its crucial role in understanding and addressing threats to society.
description: This article discusses a collective open letter signed by Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, urging the protection of disinformation research. It emphasizes the crucial role of such research in understanding and addressing threats to society.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi (University of Urbino Carlo Bo) facilitated a project at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School focusing on the persistence and resilience of misinformation despite fact-checking efforts, particularly concerning Facebook scams and misinformation related to Emmanuel Macron.
description: This article discusses a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School, focusing on the persistence and resilience of misinformation related to Facebook scams and Emmanuel Macron, showing relevance to his research areas.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team involved in the vera.ai project. The team coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4), focusing on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time by addressing coordinated sharing behavior using social media analysis and network science methods.
description: This article from vera.ai introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team involved in the vera.ai project, which focuses on discovering potentially problematic content using social media analysis and network science methods.
